E7D7797EBE3F4A8BAB7011B740AD5D9B.description: establish and use criteria to evaluate group process and personal contributions; set goals and make plans for improvement

A84AE09C11B746538AE5E7039EF81DBA.description: share responsibility for the completion of team projects by establishing clear purpose and procedures for solving problems, monitoring progress and making modifications to meet stated objectives

22EA285504A4459E99C4BF8362E84D93.description: generate and access ideas in a group, and use a variety of methods to focus and clarify topics for research or investigations

938D7281CF334CD58A58E4E17B0EBC2B.description: discuss and choose ways to coordinate the abilities and interests of individual group members to achieve group goals

D8141138968947FF82AF246C51B0FFDE.description: contribute to group efforts to reach consensus or conclusions, by engaging in dialogue to understand the ideas and viewpoints of others

88BC3A2A76314FA8B713CFE02676133C.description: create or use oral, print and other media texts in ways that are respectful of people, opinions, communities and cultures

17475A348AB7499A80D118D21D1A4D2F.description: explore and experiment with various ways in which language arts are used across cultures, age groups and genders to honour and celebrate people and events

F89A64799F6240CC9246CAD18E19543B.description: analyze how oral, print and other media texts reflect the traditions, beliefs and technologies of different cultures, communities or periods in history

F1261C5D7D3A4C6EB7766148584200B0.description: take responsibility for developing and sharing oral, print and other media texts and for responding respectfully to the texts of others

3F3632B32DFB46EB83F4954B3B97AC50.description: examine how personal experiences, cultural traditions and Canadian perspectives are presented in oral, print and other media texts

79A6DA73E42740F286A806A3227FD4E7.description: Respect, support and collaborate with others

447077D68986417DA141C5D9952F2DF8.description: provide feedback that encourages the presenter and audience to consider other ideas and additional information

7C5C8EF40F924B02B366BE028D4DA5F2.description: follow the train of thought, and evaluate the credibility of the presenter and the evidence provided

F1CE11102EC04277A47DCE1F66D4C1EB.description: integrate a variety of media and display techniques, as appropriate, to enhance the appeal, accuracy and persuasiveness of presentations

8130D12A036B4068A26EAE7384607472.description: Use effective oral and visual communication

B6A4D36454854C4587431ECC83BBA57C.description: choose appropriate types of evidence and strategies to clarify ideas and information, and to convince various readers and audiences

7344B6663FC64714B1D0F698C8C4A8AC.description: select, organize and present information to appeal to the interests and background knowledge of various readers or audiences

F4522AA85BE84DD68661F1F77E5D2C4F.description: know that rules for punctuation can vary, and adjust punctuation use for effect in own writing

B7D936B9A4EA4625B02D166787B3A426.description: use dashes to show sentence breaks or interrupted speech, where appropriate in own writing

8B60AE65BE49400D820741C55BEF6855.description: use quotation marks to distinguish words being discussed in own writing

B3105F3011364B7EA79A2F7C973BADB3.description: identify and use variant spellings for particular effects, depending on audience, purpose, content and context

39A86ED2426947FA816B696E01D71D0B.description: identify situations in which careful attention to correct spelling is especially important

6CC76BD6ADD0492491B02ACF5B40CD42.description: demonstrate the deliberate, conscientious and independent application of a variety of editing and proofreading strategies to confirm spellings in own writing

D9607FC192C643ADA7E141A5BD345A37.description: use a variety of strategies to make effective transitions between sentences and paragraphs in own writing

C535993EC59B4C0BBFB7BF4589373FB3.description: identify and use coordination, subordination and apposition to enhance communication

5CDE38AD4BAC4CD08C5647D05CF2E522.description: identify and use parallel structure in own writing

0FD2D977565544F987EB07DBFDDF134D.description: experiment with the language and components of particular forms to communicate themes or represent the perspectives of a variety of people or characters

E5B587CF7AED4744959EA379DAE15D14.description: explore the derivation and use of words, phrases and jargon, including variations in language, accent and dialect in Canadian communities and regions

62464A15FE3744678BFA59ADB1369157.description: distinguish between the denotative and connotative meaning of words, and discuss effectiveness for achieving purpose and affecting audience

6DA1583688CE4BF4B4C6351D2C4E8B2D.description: identify and experiment with some principles of design that enhance the presentation of texts

92414D3210C94EC4A974FE49777FCE55.description: develop personal handwriting styles appropriate for a variety of purposes

3E2D1DD21D144B58819AA1DBDB9A4579.description: revise to combine narration, description and exposition effectively

F2D9D52558DB47EBA296C1198DB2D645.description: revise to enhance effective transitions between ideas and maintain a consistent organizational pattern

E8547FCDE1454F2C968D6037A434F0B6.description: revise to ensure effective introductions, consistent points of view, effective transitions between ideas and appropriate conclusions

284AA1C755284568A739E3DC85821BF7.description: work collaboratively to make appropriate revisions based on feedback provided by peers

7D98565880724F0F80B28A7A57B1EF3E.description: share sample treatments of a topic with peers, and ask for feedback on the relative effectiveness of each

4E16A1650F3642FAA8B459AD6A8269B4.description: Enhance the clarity and artistry of communication

3507432E1E454FABACBA48087E744A0D.description: reflect on the research process, identifying areas of strength and ways to improve further research activities

B506BD67C3A841CB8230189AF0237B79.description: integrate appropriate visual, print and/or other media to reinforce overall impression or point of view and engage the audience

4AC74627C16446DA8A8B9B4282E6F110.description: communicate ideas and information in a variety of oral, print and other media texts, such as media scripts, multimedia presentations, panel discussions and articles

52BB805676914337B0CC7AE0092B678B.description: reflect on new understanding and its value to self and others

D2C74AA7804342B6B3BFB6D98DFF2E70.description: evaluate usefulness, relevance and completeness of gathered information; address information gaps

6F973C7EA18B41368743185C251B50E9.description: choose specific vocabulary, and use conventions accurately and effectively to enhance credibility

D77ACD8B68E545FC9A4102923B927BDC.description: select and record ideas and information that will support an opinion or point of view, appeal to the audience, and suit the tone and length of the chosen form of oral, print or other media text

70E5BCCFA1D24EE8BA73B50376DD4864.description: use own words to summarize and record information in a variety of forms; paraphrase and/or quote relevant facts and opinions; reference sources

6556B33103C240F9B16C8BAB8242AA5A.description: develop coherence by relating all key ideas to the overall purpose of the oral, print or other media text

F66CF546D7DF403486E905130BCDFC4E.description: balance all sections of oral, print and other media texts and ensure sentences, paragraphs and key ideas are linked throughout

CED5877CA04D4FAC9DCAEB658DAA9DE9.description: organize ideas and information by developing and selecting appropriate categories and organizational structures

44219C16506C43F191D81545BDC688B0.description: evaluate sources for currency, reliability and possible bias of information for a particular research project

6508BE1D15D2401198CC46C51827F27B.description: follow up on cited references to locate additional information

51186540FAB146D183BE21804A39829B.description: distinguish between primary and secondary sources, and determine the usefulness of each for research purposes

515E75689CE94C278D3EDF3883B8CF9C.description: expand and use a variety of tools and text features, such as organizational patterns of texts, page layouts, font styles and sizes, colour and voiceovers, to access information

D19850D77B0D4729A7C6BE52252A6F2A.description: obtain information reflecting multiple perspectives from a variety of sources, such as expository essays, graphs, diagrams, online catalogues, periodical indices, film libraries, electronic databases and the Internet, when conducting research

9C0859673E064B47AE0196CEBC35CE7B.description: select information sources that will provide effective support, convincing argument or unique perspectives

BC947C449BC348AE841A11455EDCB676.description: select types and sources of information to achieve an effective balance between researched information and own ideas

7D62853405B247FC981F565216C73DAB.description: assess adequacy, accuracy, detail and appropriateness of oral, print and other media texts to support or further develop arguments, opinions or points of view

D8E995C322864D28B6FF9E3EDC6EFBFA.description: synthesize ideas and information from a variety of sources to develop own opinions, points of view and general impressions

1FFD5CAF683B4E90BBC25A170E82452E.description: create oral, print and other media texts that include main and minor characters, and show how the main character develops and changes as a result of the action and events

06F4D6170224436EBBF573805AF271C9.description: create oral, print and other media texts that interrelate plot, setting and character, and reveal the significance of the action

E52C083AA3614419A6A66B1057E13D56.description: create oral, print and other media texts on common literary themes

302BBB750176445EB188B1FF33EFEFCB.description: Elaborate on the expression of ideas

F9270CDDBC9B4BCF8CAE012F6EBB509A.description: generalize from own experience to create oral, print and other media texts on a theme

98FCEA9C3F184DA9B2312661815FBF0E.description: analyze creative uses of language and visuals in popular culture, such as advertisements, electronic magazines and the Internet; recognize how imagery and figurative language, such as metaphor, create a dominant impression, mood and tone

2256F5A91C634948AA729AE79F87B8B3.description: summarize the content of media texts, and suggest alternative treatments

97B93CD9F80F43CCBEA104A15AA1B585.description: identify ways that a change in narrator might affect the overall meaning of oral, print and other media texts

2E7D18EEC168409E8684BF26249597D7.description: compare a main character in one text to the main character in another text from a different era, genre or medium

FA78AB8ED473478C9548DCAC0DB9D968.description: evaluate the effectiveness of oral, print and other media texts, considering the believability of plot and setting, the credibility of characters, and the development and resolution of conflict

9EC6F5C03E1C428E8F3258FE437C5CF9.description: compare the development of character, plot and theme in two oral, print or other media texts

0BBC1A10443B4B17BA097F25C43F8356.description: evaluate the effectiveness of different types of media texts for presenting ideas and information

E09E604834A3451FB759BAB79DFA05FD.description: explain the relationships between purposes and characteristics of various forms and genres of oral, print and other media texts

038959916F0B450FB6857AADF275C828.description: identify features that define particular oral, print and other media texts; discuss differences in style and their effects on content and audience impression

7C32A2C960EA4BD3BB753001DE2D0211.description: describe how theme, dominant impression and mood are developed and sustained through choices in language use and the interrelationship of plot, setting and character

6A5D483D92D44B2FA80B97922752725C.description: discuss character development in terms of consistency of behaviour and plausibility of change

D70BD1DCFB63467FA8DEF5205C1A1EEB.description: discuss how techniques, such as irony, symbolism, perspective and proportion, communicate meaning and enhance effect in oral, print and other media texts

235A2F0235684762A2E83700C3B61BF7.description: relate the themes, emotions and experiences portrayed in oral, print and other media texts to issues of personal interest or significance

AA240892A2D14941A3B2BD7BB0534EF1.description: discuss and explain various interpretations of the same oral, print or other media text

34D5CF78D1574AB1A0E38FF0E29A39CE.description: identify and discuss theme and point of view in oral, print and other media texts

EF1185DFD32148F3ACD3C4F5C54069C9.description: analyze how the choices and motives of characters portrayed in oral, print and other media texts provide insight into those of self and others

CEC9BFA7054F4334928FACD1E7246B69.description: consider peers’ interpretations of oral, print and other media texts, referring to the texts for supporting or contradicting evidence

04380A9813774C4FA440F6089F968046.description: express the themes of oral, print or other media texts in different forms or genres

E7476AD517884E91AD9767694D3B0714.description: compare and contrast own life situation with themes of oral, print and other media texts

9BDAA3B6F4B74949BF79E52B163397F2.description: consider historical context when developing own points of view or interpretations of oral, print and other media texts

6E6A0258209F4478B6DC261D15858018.description: identify and discuss how timeless themes are developed in a variety of oral, print and other media texts

E31845270B3F487FB5A58EBB58421D66.description: experience oral, print and other media texts from a variety of cultural traditions and genres, such as essays, broadcast advertisements, novels, poetry, documentaries, films, electronic magazines and realistic fiction

A875CBE890A64104BC432B55A15B1A0B.description: use reference materials, including a writer’s handbook, to verify correct usage, address uncertainties and solve problems that arise

92CA5D78BA314FD09F5D41FF8285FE52.description: apply and explain effective procedures for identifying and comprehending words in context; adjust procedures according to the purpose for reading and the complexity of the texts

6E5D3F69B81D4452B2B8474E1B7D3532.description: analyze and discuss how the structural features of informational materials, such as textbooks, bibliographies, databases, catalogues, web sites, commercials and newscasts, enhance the effectiveness and efficiency of communication

E3C9DEDFABDA4EC79BB4F651F015AF0C.description: use knowledge of visual and textual cues and structural features when skimming and scanning various print and other media texts to locate relevant information effectively and efficiently

044CC77A55904F498CD9E40B93E0925D.description: preview complex texts as to their intent, content and structure, and use this information to set a purpose and select strategies for reading

95435DD813BE43BD8B4AFB6169898C68.description: select appropriate reading rate and strategies for comprehending texts less closely connected to prior knowledge and personal experiences

24A5D3908ACE4EF2ADE8274BE6890D44.description: identify explicit and implicit ideas and information in texts; listen and respond to various interpretations of the same text

6156CCFF706842929C7CFD7687C690F1.description: use previous reading experiences, personal experiences and prior knowledge as a basis for reflecting on and interpreting ideas encountered in texts

309BB0E361394DEC8B46AE275F9F8AE2.description: discuss how interpretations of the same text might vary, according to the prior knowledge and experiences of various readers

498A2D7BACCB49E29E331DDF898C14ED.description: Comprehend and respond personally and critically to oral print and other media texts

2678B7F3BF5D464EB8691B1AE2A0F854.description: assess whether new information extends understanding by considering diverse opinions and exploring ambiguities

F6D0ACD420B6441E92A42F5695640F76.description: examine and re-examine ideas, information and experiences from different points of view to find patterns and see relationships

9F04B319EF744A42853CD9DA71722B18.description: integrate own perspectives and interpretations with new understandings developed through discussing and through experiencing a variety of oral, print and other media texts

019086D3BD3742C59F50CA4B1DAE5B3E.description: reflect on own growth in language learning and use, by considering progress over time and the attainment of personal goals

A08AB804BB8C48CAA5340514A6B293FC.description: explain preferences for texts and genres by particular writers, artists, storytellers and filmmakers

3A9AE8DD636C4888BF70126520320A19.description: develop and extend understanding by expressing and responding to ideas on the same topic, in a variety of forms of oral, print and other media texts

6027494C6EC34145B3F1BDA753291A5F.description: extend understanding by taking different points of view when rereading and reflecting on oral, print and other media texts

121DF4249A7E4E71BACF539D457E725B.description: explore and explain how interactions with others and with oral, print and other media texts affect personal understandings

99A00E4F755A49209973D220C7F23026.description: talk with others and experience a variety of oral, print and other media texts to explore, develop and justify own opinions and points of view

6AF370628153443CB798AF6D2103C901.description: Explore thoughts, ideas, feelings and experiences
